job_title: Patient Care Technician in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Experience Learn a lot about the field and patients
cons: A lot f physical labor

review_title: Good company in a rough part of Jax
job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: The NICU is always busy, roughly a 60 bed unit, but pt ratios are always manageable- usually 3 neonates a nurse (1 acute and 2 more stable pts). The charge nurses offer their help frequently. The nurses very helpful and nice! Since our hospital is unionized, the pay is amazing- the weekend differentials is $6 extra, and the night differentials is $5 extra for nurses. If you work weekend-nights: you can stack the differentials together and get $11/hr extra.
cons: Its a state-run hospital in the middle of the city. Alerts get sent to staff at least once a week that there was some sort of crazy incident. One week, it was a guy who threw a brick into a staff member's car window, another week, someone stole a construction tractor and ran it into the hospital entrance (Yes, you read that right). Peds ICU, there are practically no patients. They are thinking of shutting the unit down. Wolfson's (a hospital across town) has all the specialist there, so our pts usually get shipped off to Wolfsons. If your thinking of Peds ICU, apply to Wolfson's instead.

review_title: Not the worst but not the best
pros: PTO and Sick leave are separate. It is pretty easy to get days off as long as you have the time accrued. The rehab department is really helpful and welcoming to new staff.
cons: The pay is extremely low. If you're working outpatient, then a lot of time is spent cleaning behind therapists and CSR work.

pros: Great mission, great people, great benefits
cons: None that I can think of

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Everything abt this company is amazing
cons: None, they are fleixble and nice

pros: It is a very challenging place to work.  You learn a lot if you are willing to learn.  You are submerged in many learning experiences daily.
cons: The PCA's are terrible.  They give you attitude about doing their job.  You are incharge of making sure the residents don't kill your patients.  Almost everyone has a major attitude.  It is not a very welcoming place to start.  Nurses will be doing primary care even though there are PCA's.

pros: The Benefits are good. The staff work great together. Great learning experience. Because it is a teaching hospital you receive excellent Heath care.
cons: Management do not value loyalty in its employees.  They have a tendency to let personal feelings stray them when making decisions or taking action with employees.

review_title: Management needs to get a clue
pros: The only reason I work here is to help the patients who are ill and  need help.
cons: Management is so self centered and ridiculous  that they don't even know what's going on in their own departments.   They criticize the people that do all of the work and  gossip with the tattletales backstabbers and brown nose-ers.

review_title: Learned a lot: pay was great
pros: You will always be busy: there is lots to see and learn. Pretty good pay for RNs. Lots of opportunities to move around if you don't like your work area.
cons: Some of the patients can be pretty difficult to deal with.  Some of the management can be out of touch and harsh to employees

pros: Competitive Pay, good benefits, big hospital, teaching facility, offers good learning, some staff/employees are friendly...some are not. More cons than pros!
cons: Location (downtown), kind of patients (no insurance), parking, micromanagement, plenty of bosses; Understaff, understaff and undetstaff... current staff have to take more work loads to compensate undetstaffing problems. Overwork most of the time.

pros: Pay was fair and working with co worker somrtime positive experience
cons: A lot of policies  and procedures.   Manager always trying to cover mistake by using employee as scapegoat. So you have to be able to handle its not personal.   Be able do your job and go home.

pros:
Management was flexible with worked hours and compensation.
Great benefits 
Promotes from within the company
Pay was good
Some management actually cared about their staff.
cons:
Not enough stress on important feedback
impossible "max" raises
Raises in general stunk
Must be in the "Clique"
Not enough training provided

review_title: Good and bad depending on  what area you work in.
job_title: Client Services Representative Senior in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Great co workers and  employees on the lower levels overall.
cons: The lack of advancement  of  employees who are seasoned and know  the jobs  but are  not given the  chance  and are overlooked  for  management positions.   They will hire from outside the company before they advance someone from  the inside.

review_title: Good place to start a career
pros: Great learning environment, decent health insurance
cons: No raises of any kind in four years.  Although our workload has more than doubled, management has decided to withhold any pay increases.  Good ol Boy atmosphere.

review_title: They couldn't pay me enough to return to this awful place.

review_title: They cover up problems instead of providing solutions.

pros: Large organization with great benefits and above average salary. Organization is slowing improving and acceptance is growing in the community.

pros: Better pay than most hospitals in the city.  Flexible scheduling.
